newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine's Sevastopol airport to get upgrade.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine's Sevastopol airport to get upgrade.

text.p: Bilbek airport at Ukraine's Black Sea city of Sevastopol will be upgraded to an international one starting with regular flights to Moscow, Ukrinform Business News weekly bulletin said on Monday.
It quoted Vladimir Perekalsky, head of Sevastopol's Bilbek airport, as saying flights to Moscow would be launched with a stopover in Ukraine's central industrial city of Dnipropetrovsk.
The report did not say when the flights would be launched or which other international destinations could be served and airport officials could not immediately be contacted.

Bilbek, which served for decades as a military airbase for the Black Sea fleet in Soviet days, launched charter flights to Kiev two years ago when Ukrainian authorities opened Sevastopol for domestic visitors and foreigners.
Last year 186 Kiev-Sevastopol flights were made by Air Ukraine and Krym (Crimea) air companies. This month flights to the Ukrainian cities of Lviv, Poltava and Donetsk are due to be launched.
Perekalsky was quoted as saying Bilbek airport was considering proposals from investors to modernise its passenger terminal, customs and border offices for $300,000.
The next step, he added, would be to build a proper passenger terminal with a hotel and restaurants at a cost of $18.5 million -- though sources of cash had been identified yet.
Bilbek has 3,600 square metres of cargo storage and aviation experts say it could be used as a major cargo transit point on the Crimean peninsula, which attracts millions of tourists.
Earlier this year the Ukrainian government ordered a reduction in the number of airports serving international routes due to the cost of customs and passport control services.
Of Ukraine's 37 airports, 17 serve international routes.
